statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Loyola, Md. 77, Manhattan 58
article.story: NEW YORK (AP) -- Gerald Brown led a balanced scoring attack with 16 points and Loyola, Maryland, held Manhattan without a 3-pointer for the first time in 12 years as the Greyhounds posted a 77-58 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference victory Sunday. Michael Tuck scored 15 points and Josko Alujevic and Marquis Sullivan had 14 points each for the Greyhounds (5-3, 1-1 MAAC). Darryl Crawford had 18 points and Devon Austin added 11 for the Jaspers (3-6, 1-1). Manhattan missed all nine of its 3-point attempts, and had its school-record streak of 326 consecutive games with at least one 3-pointer snapped. The last time the team did not hit a 3-pointer was Dec. 29, 1994, in a 54-51 win over Colgate. Loyola held the Jaspers to 35.3 percent shooting overall, while the Greyhounds shot 47.2 percent from the floor. Tuck scored eight points and Alujevic and Hassan Fofana had seven each in leading Loyola to a 32-27 halftime lead. The Greyhounds led 55-40 after Tuck hit a 3-pointer with 10:36 left in the game. Guy Ngarndi's two free throws capped a 12-2 scoring run for Manhattan that narrowed the deficit to 61-54 with 6:10 left. But Loyola then ran off straight 16 points, capped by Alujevic's 3-pointer to take a 77-54 lead with 1:19 to go.
